alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 9:25AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harrison and eastern Hancock Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 925 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waveland, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Long Beach, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Saucier, Lyman, Shoreline Park and Kiln. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 13 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison
